intro: Hedysarum kopetdaghi, commonly known as the Kopetdag heddysarum, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. It plays a role in soil stabilization and may have potential uses in ecological restoration projects. Its botanical features make it an important species for studying plant adaptation in extreme climates.
